intro: Crematomia kunthiana, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has a compact, low-growing structure with hairy leaves and yellow ray florets. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Crematomia kunthiana plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert environments and provides nectar for pollinators.
